Interface Message

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageImpl

    public interface Message
    A message which stores a string along with the number of characters and digits that appear within that string. This is done to meet the specification of the exercise being undertaken.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Aidan O'Grady

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCharacterCount()
      Gets the character count field and returns to the caller.
      int getDigitCount()
      Gets the digit count field and returns to the caller.
      java.lang.String getMessage()
      Gets the message that is stored within the class, and returns it.
      void setCounts()
      Sets the number of characters and number of digits that appear in the message.
      void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Sets the message field to the string that is passed to the method.

    • Method Detail

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the message field to the string that is passed to the method.
        Parameters:
        The - message that is to be stored within the class.

      • setCounts

        void setCounts()
        Sets the number of characters and number of digits that appear in the message. This is done in the one method since obtaining the number of characters is extremely simple, and thus can be done before setting the number of digits.

      • getMessage

        java.lang.String getMessage()
        Gets the message that is stored within the class, and returns it.
        Returns:
        the message in its string format.

      • getCharacterCount

        int getCharacterCount()
        Gets the character count field and returns to the caller.
        Returns:
        the character count.

      • getDigitCount

        int getDigitCount()
        Gets the digit count field and returns to the caller.
        Returns:
        the number of digits appearing within the string.
